meanings.definition: The process or art of producing books, newspapers, etc., by mechanical means.
meanings.sent1: Learning about printing in school helped me understand how books are made.
meanings.sent2: The printing of newspapers is done in a large factory with specialized machines.
meanings.sent3: I tried to explain printing to my cat, but he just purred and walked away.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a printing press, spreading joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the printing press echoed through the building, a rhythmic symphony of creation.

meanings.definition: The act of producing text or images on paper or other material using a printing press or printer.
meanings.sent1: My dad showed me how printing works on our home printer.
meanings.sent2: The printing of the invitations for the party took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled coffee on the printing, creating a unique design.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a printing press, leaving a lasting impression on everyone.
meanings.sent5: The printing on the packaging was so clear, it looked like it was painted on.

meanings.definition: The business or industry of producing printed material.
meanings.sent1: Working in the printing industry requires attention to detail and precision.
meanings.sent2: The printing business has evolved with the advancement of technology.
meanings.sent3: I dreamt of a world where the printing industry was run by cats.
meanings.sent4: The printing industry is a colorful tapestry of creativity and innovation.
meanings.sent5: The smell of ink in the printing shop was a familiar and comforting scent.
